wasGeneratedBy.description: 2 kHz stimulation of hippocampal neurons under 1.0V amplitude (measured as one polarity, V; peak-to-peak would be two-fold larger). Sine wave amplitude is gradually increased during the initial 0.25 s, then stays constant at the indicated voltage. Sine wave stimulation begins at 25 ms and lasts 2 s. For the employed electrode configuration, 1V translates into 36 V/cm. All experiments were performed in a low-conductance physiological solution containing (in mM): 140 NaGluconate, 5.4 KCl, 2 CaCl2, 1.5 MgCl2, 10 D-glucose, and 10 HEPES (pH 7.3, 290-300 mOsm/kg, 0.8 S/m).
wasGeneratedBy.name: 2kHz_stimulation_1,0V
